intro: Lophodium rigidum, commonly known as the rigid lophodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Lophodium rigidum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm climates.
